body.description: Send `!hello` to see some information about me.
body.hint: Using this command, you can get a quick description as well as see my version number and the time I've been working.

body.description: This is the command you're using! Send `!help [[X]]` to have me explain a command in detail.
body.hint: You can also send just the name of the command without the ! character.
I can only send an explanation of one command at a time.
For commands with arguments in double brackets, you just need to send the name of the command. Don't send any brackets.
For example, to get an explanation of the `!binary` command, you should send: `!help [[!binary]]`.

body.description: You can also send `!help` with no arguments to get a list of commands.

function.error: Make sure the command you want help with is surrounded by double brackets. If you want a list of all commands, don't send any brackets.
I need a command to search for. If you want a list of all commands, don't send any brackets.
I can only search for one command at a time.
I don't have the command you're searching for. If you want a list of all commands, send `!help` with no arguments.

body.description: Send `!announce [[X|Y|Z]]` to have me send everyone a notification after the set time.
body.hint: Time can be set with s(econds), h(ours), and d(ays).
Time cannot exceed 30 days.
Separate each argument in the brackets with the | character.
I will ignore any more than three arguments of this format.
You can set a custom message by typing anywhere in the message outside of the brackets.
For example, to remind everyone to join you in a game in two and a half days, send: `!announce [[2d|12h]] play game`.
Only server administrators can use this command.

body.description: You can also use a special format to set an announcement for a certain date.
body.hint: You must supply the date, time, and timezone as a UTC offset.
Date should be format `MM/DD/YYYY`.
Time should be format `HH:MM` as a 24 hour clock.
UTC offset should be format `(+/-)HHHH`.
The date you set cannot be before the current date and time.
I will ignore any more than one argument of this format.
I can only use either time or a date argument. If you send both, I will only set an announcement based on the date argument.
For example, to set an announcement for your birthday party on May 21, 2021 at 2:30 PM US Mountain Time, send: `!announce [[05/20/2021 14:30 -0600]] birthday party`.

function.error: Make sure the time or date you want me to use to set your announcement is surrounded by double brackets.
I need at least one time or date argument to set your announcement.
Make sure your time arguments use only integers and use letters to set s(econds), h(ours), or d(ays).
Time arguments cannot exceed 30 days.
The time arguments must last at least one second.
Make sure your date argument is in the proper format: `MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM (+/-)HHHH`.
Date arguments must be set for a date in the future.

body.description: Send `!binary [[X]]` to have me convert your number to binary.
body.hint: I can only convert one number at a time and only numbers 0-65535.
For example, to convert 5 to binary, you should send: `!binary [[5]]`.

function.error: Make sure the number you want me to convert is surrounded by double brackets.
I need a number to convert.
I can only convert one number at a time.
I can only convert integers to binary.
I can only convert numbers 0-65535 to binary.

body.description: Send `!hex [[X]]` to have me convert your number to hexadecimal.
body.hint: I can only convert one number at a time and only numbers 0-65535.
For example, to convert 5 to hexadecimal, you should send: `!hex [[5]]`.

function.error: Make sure the number you want me to convert is surrounded by double brackets.
I need a number to convert.
I can only convert one number at a time.
I can only convert integers to hexadecimal.
I can only convert numbers 0-65535 to hexadecimal.

body.description: Send `!magic [[X]]` to have me search for a Magic: The Gathering card.
body.hint: I can search for up to three cards, just make sure they're all in the same double brackets and separate them with the | character.
For example, to search for Island, you should send: `!magic [[island]]`.
I can also search for a random card using the word "random". For example: `!magic [[random]]`.

You can also use Scryfall's syntax to add search terms to random as long as they don't contain the | character. For example, to search for a random red and green commander, you should send: `!magic [[random c=rg is:commander]]`.

function.error: Make sure the cards you want me to search for are surrounded by double brackets.
I need at least one card to search for.
I can only search for at most three cards at a time.

body.description: Send `!poll [[X|Y]]` to have me start a poll with the given options.
body.hint: When the poll is running, people can vote on the choices by increasing the corresponding reactions that I add to the poll message. Adding new reactions will not do anything.
The poll will automatically be open for one hour, but you can end it early by send `!end` in the same channel.
When the poll is concluded, I will display the results.
You can set a custom poll question by typing anywhere in the message outside of the brackets.
I need at least two options, but you can send up to five.
You can only run a single poll per channel at a time.
For example, to poll people on what their favorite color is, send: `!poll What is your favorite color? [[Red|Yellow|Blue]]`.

function.error: Make sure the options you want on the poll are surrounded by double brackets.
I need at least two poll options for people to vote on.
I can only set up to five options for people to vote on.

body.description: Send `!remind [[X|Y|Z]]` to have me send you a notification after the set time.
body.hint: Time can be set with s(econds), h(ours), and d(ays).
Time cannot exceed 30 days.
Separate each argument in the brackets with the | character.
I will ignore any more than three arguments of this format.
You can set a custom message by typing anywhere in the message outside of the brackets.
For example, to remind yourself to go to sleep in two and a half hours, send: `!announce [[2h|30m]] go to sleep`.

body.description: You can also use a special format to set a reminder for a certain date.
body.hint: You must supply the date, time, and timezone as a UTC offset.
Date should be format `MM/DD/YYYY`.
Time should be format `HH:MM` as a 24 hour clock.
UTC offset should be format `(+/-)HHHH`.
The date you set cannot be before the current date and time.
I will ignore any more than one argument of this format.
I can only use either time or a date argument. If you send both, I will only set a reminder based on the date argument.
For example, to set a reminder for a friend's birthday party on May 21, 2021 at 2:30 PM US Mountain Time, send: `!remind [[05/20/2021 14:30 -0600]] birthday party`.

function.error: Make sure the time or date you want me to use to set your reminder is surrounded by double brackets.
I need at least one time or date argument to set your reminder.
Make sure your time arguments use only integers and use letters to set s(econds), h(ours), or d(ays).
Time arguments cannot exceed 30 days.
The time arguments must last at least one second.
Make sure your date argument is in the proper format: `MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM (+/-)HHHH`.
Date arguments must be set for a date in the future.

body.description: Send `!roll [[X]]` to have me roll a die.
body.hint: I can only roll one die at a time.
The die must have at least 2 sides (I guess that's just a coin?) and can have up to 1000 sides.
For example, to roll a 6-sided die, you should send: `!roll [[6]]`.

function.error: Make sure the number of sides of your die is surrounded by double brackets.
I need a number of sides to roll a die.
I can only roll one die at a time.
I can only roll a die with an integer number of sides.
I can only roll a die with 0-1000 sides.

body.description: Send `!wiki [[X]]` to have me search for a Wikipedia article.
body.hint: I can only search for one article at a time.
I can't screen the content I find, so please don't break server rules by searching for certain articles!
For example, to search for "shiba inu," you should send: `!wiki [[Shiba Inu]]`.

function.error: Make sure the article you want me to search for is surrounded by double brackets.
I need an article to search for.
I can only search for one article at a time.

body.description: Send `!ask` to get a yes or no answer to something.
Send `!choose [[X|Y]]` to have me choose from your options.
body.hint: I need at least two choices to choose from, but you can send up to ten.
Make sure you separate each choice using the | character.
For example, to choose from cats or dogs, you should send: `!choose [[cats|dogs]]`.

function.error: Make sure the options you want me to choose from are surrounded by double brackets.
I need at least two things to choose from.
I can only choose from at most 10 things at a time.

body.description: Send `!cute` to have me send a random cute animal picture.
Send `!joke` to have me send a one-liner joke. Laughs are not guaranteed.
Send `!react` to have me send a random reaction image.
body.hint: If I am allowed to delete messages, the message you send will be deleted and its contents logged on my server.

body.description: Send `!rate [[X]]` to have me rate something on a scale from 1 to 10.
body.hint: I can only rate one thing at a time.
For example, to rate Discord, you should send: `!rate [[Discord]]`.

function.error: Make sure the thing you want me to rate is surrounded by double brackets.
I need something to rate.
I can only rate one thing at a time.
